summary: This is a court order from Judge Kenneth A. Marra compelling the U.S. Attorney's Office to produce the non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein to the petitioners (Jane Does 1 and 2) and other identified victims, subject to a strict protective order prohibiting disclosure to third parties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office that the petitioners are seeking to compel.

persons.name: Kenneth A. Marra
persons.context: Issued the order compelling production of the non-prosecution agreement and establishing the protective order.

persons.name: Jane Does 1 and 2
persons.context: Filed the motion to compel production of the non-prosecution agreement between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: The petitioners are identified as victims of Epstein, seeking the non-prosecution agreement related to his case.

connections.person1: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
connections.description: Parties to the non-prosecution agreement that is the subject of the court order.

events.title: Court Order to Compel Production of Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Judge Kenneth A. Marra orders the U.S. Attorney's Office to produce the non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein to the petitioners and other identified victims under a protective order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of Florida
West Palm Beach, Palm Beach County, Florida
keyFacts: The court granted a motion to compel the U.S. Attorney's Office to produce the non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein.
The production is subject to a strict protective order prohibiting disclosure of the agreement's terms to third parties without further court order.
The order applies not only to the petitioners (Jane Does 1 and 2) but also to other individuals identified by the USAO as victims of Epstein.
The document reveals ongoing civil litigation where victims were seeking transparency about the government's agreement with Epstein.
